content.value:
It would be less stressful if the rebased branch was versioned 😏 git is a versioning tool after all...
Imagine that when rebasing, git marks the old branch as rebased, keeping the old commits stored... Then if you screwed up a rebase, you could restore the branch as it was
content.html: It would be less stressful if the rebased branch was versioned 😏 git is a versioning tool after all... Imagine that when rebasing, git marks the old branch as rebased, keeping the old commits stored... Then if you screwed up a rebase, you could restore the branch as it was
